result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:05 AM Defendant Rahe T Reed in court.  Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court for Rahe T Reed.  Attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense will be meeting with the State to discuss this case and come to a resolution.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:36 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rahe T Reed in court.  Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court for Rahe T Reed. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense has not received an offer, requests another status, waiting on global offer.
State sent an offer back in March but will resend offer.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rahe T Reed in court.  Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court for Rahe T Reed. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense needs to meet with the State, requests status in July.
Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.
NG plea entered.

8:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rahe T Reed in court.  Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court for Rahe T Reed. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
$5,000 SIGNATURE BOND

***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

10:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rahe T Reed in court, in custody.  Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court for Rahe T Reed. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense is not ready for a hearing today. Requests to address bond, lowering the cash. 
State objects to bond modification. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits. Motion to modify bond granted to $500 cash, and $5000 signature, same conditions and no driving at all.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rahe T Reed appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Rahe T Reed. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
